intro: Linaria depauperata subsp. hegelmaieri, commonly known as the Hegelmaier's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow-orange flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow leaves and reduced floral structures compared to other members of the species. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. This plant is often found in coastal and inland areas of the Canary Islands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
